citation.abstract:
To determine the incidence, cost, and outcome of severe sepsis in the United States.
Observational cohort study.
All nonfederal hospitals (n = 847) in seven U.S. states.
All patients (n = 192,980) meeting criteria for severe sepsis based on the International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification.
None.
We linked all 1995 state hospital discharge records (n = 6,621,559) from seven large states with population and hospital data from the U.S. Census, the Centers for Disease Control, the Health Care Financing Administration, and the American Hospital Association. We defined severe sepsis as documented infection and acute organ dysfunction using criteria based on the International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification. We validated these criteria against prospective clinical and physiologic criteria in a subset of five hospitals. We generated national age- and gender-adjusted estimates of incidence, cost, and outcome. We identified 192,980 cases, yielding national estimates of 751,000 cases (3.0 cases per 1,000 population and 2.26 cases per 100 hospital discharges), of whom 383,000 (51.1%) received intensive care and an additional 130,000 (17.3%) were ventilated in an intermediate care unit or cared for in a coronary care unit. Incidence increased >100-fold with age (0.2/1,000 in children to 26.2/1,000 in those >85 yrs old). Mortality was 28.6%, or 215,000 deaths nationally, and also increased with age, from 10% in children to 38.4% in those >85 yrs old. Women had lower age-specific incidence and mortality, but the difference in mortality was explained by differences in underlying disease and the site of infection. The average costs per case were $22,100, with annual total costs of $16.7 billion nationally. Costs were higher in infants, nonsurvivors, intensive care unit patients, surgical patients, and patients with more organ failure. The incidence was projected to increase by 1.5% per annum.
Severe sepsis is a common, expensive, and frequently fatal condition, with as many deaths annually as those from acute myocardial infarction. It is especially common in the elderly and is likely to increase substantially as the U.S. population ages.
citation.title: Epidemiology of severe sepsis in the United States: analysis of incidence, outcome, and associated costs of care.

author.name: 敗血症/Sepsisの情報発信
author.description: 敗血症という病気を知っていますか？ 敗血症（Sepsis）に関する日本の一般市民・医療従事者両方を対象とした情報発信アカウントです。情報の拡散をしていただければ幸いです。 ※Global Sepsis Allianceや学会の公式アカウントではありません。

author.name: EARL⊿9/13世界敗血症デー
author.description: 着々とパフュクラに染まりつつあるのほほん臨床系ブロガー医です。最近はロードバイク沼にも引っ張りこまれつつあります。私をフォローすると飯テロをくらうことが多々ありますのであらかじめご了承ください。また、フォロワー数1万超えしてきたあたりから通知欄追いきれてないのでリプライに気がつかないことが多々ありますがご了承下さい。

author.name: linusnoopy i7 3930K
author.description: かつてはAIXの神だったメガネ男子。12年前うっかり買ったデジタル一眼レフから転落の人生開始。Canonから入ったのに黒点野郎でSONY転籍決定。新しいカメラ・レンズを買ったら旅に出たくなる。鉄分多し。そしてヨドバシで店員と間違えられ。楽譜書いているのが好き。でも作曲はほとんどしない。ちょっとWg.Tub.が欲しいかも

author.name: 耳の穴の大きい長い人
author.description: シベ2やばすぎ。12月には第九をやります。感染症、炎症が専門ではないけど関わりが大きい。

author.name: かあさん（ブラタモリ）
author.description: 実家は岩手県。 おじいさん1人くらいなら担げる肝っ玉かあさん。度々実家の猫さんもTLに登場します。チラッと医療。アイコンは園芸家さん作 。

author.name: ポンコツ狸吉
author.description: 薄ぼんやりと植物の如し。趣味は特撮,マンガ,SF,可動フィギュア,TRPG。悪役大好き。座右の銘「創意工夫」「無ければ作れ」原発再稼働賛成/少子化,貧困家庭問題解消/

author.name: ちゃこたん
author.description: ハロ(箱)をあいしてやまず。人生定まらないままがっつり進行中。もうファンじゃありません。先輩です。ひっちゃばく。
